abstract: Hoping to cash in on sentiment that Anheuser Busch‘s decision to sell to InBev will result in the loss of an American tradition, Pabst Brewing Company, is staking its claim as the largest remaining American-owned beer maker, according to The Milwaukee Sentinel Journal.
lead_paragraph: Hoping to cash in on sentiment that Anheuser Busch‘s decision to sell to InBev will result in the loss of an American tradition, Pabst Brewing Company, is staking its claim as the largest remaining American-owned beer maker, according to The Milwaukee Sentinel Journal.

headline.main: Pabst: The New King of American Beers?
